meanings.sent1: After losing his favorite toy, Tim was able to recoup it from under the bed.
meanings.sent2: She hoped to recoup the time she wasted by working efficiently.
meanings.sent3: Trying to recoup a lost sock in the laundry is like searching for a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent4: The team managed to recoup their lead in the final minutes of the game.
meanings.sent5: With determination, he set out to recoup his reputation after the embarrassing incident.

meanings.sent1: By selling old items, she was able to recoup some of the money she had spent on new furniture.
meanings.sent2: Investors aim to recoup their initial investment before expecting profits.
meanings.sent3: Trying to recoup money lost in a casino is like chasing a mirage in the desert.
meanings.sent4: The company managed to recoup its losses through a successful marketing campaign.
meanings.sent5: She worked extra hours to recoup the funds she had accidentally wasted.

meanings.definition: Make up for (a loss or expense)
meanings.sent1: Eating a healthy breakfast can help recoup the energy lost during sleep.
meanings.sent2: He tried to recoup his mistake by offering a sincere apology.
meanings.sent3: Trying to recoup a failed recipe by adding more ingredients can sometimes lead to disaster.
meanings.sent4: The team needed to recoup their poor performance in the next match.
meanings.sent5: She planned to recoup the time lost due to traffic by leaving earlier the next day.
